thread.title: Ground News - Athletes showcase their skills at the Special Olympics Maine Winter Games
thread.title_full: Ground News - Athletes showcase their skills at the Special Olympics Maine Winter Games

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Athletes showcase their skills at the Special Olympics Maine Winter Games
text:
Summary by Ground News The two-day Special Olympics Maine Winter Games kicked off in Auburn on Wednesday. Unseasonably warm temperatures and a lack of snow left organizers scrambling to find a new venue for some events. Cross-country and snowshoe events were originally scheduled to be held at Pineland Farm in New Gloucester. Share menu 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right
WCSH Lean Left High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Tegna Inc. Athletes showcase their skills at the Special Olympics Maine Winter Games More than 300 Special Olympians showcased their skills and celebrated their achievements at the two-day event.
